intro: Astrantia major subsp. carinthiaca, commonly known as Carpathian aster, is a perennial herb native to Central and Eastern Europe. It features upright stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces showy, flat-topped clusters of white to pale pink flowers in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade. This species is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
